job.title: Data Engineer
job.description: <p><strong><u>Job Summary:</u></strong></p><p>The Data Engineer is responsible for the implementation and maintenance of the data warehouse, and associated extract-transform-loads (ETLs). The Data Engineer will be an integral part of modernizing USA Swimming’s data culture and ensuring data is accurately and properly exposed to end users.</p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong><u>Essential Duties/Responsibilities:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Participate in architectural discussions to create and maintain optimal modern data pipeline architecture amidst ever-changing business needs.</li><li>Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using structured query language (SQL) and Azure technologies.</li><li>Design and build Azure Logic Apps to automate programs.</li><li>Expose data to end users using Data Warehouse and Power BI, or other modern reporting and visualization platform.</li><li>Work with internal and external stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and data quality issues.</li><li>Optimize data delivery and re-design infrastructure for greater scalability.</li><li>Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.</li><li>Fulfill internal and external custom SQL requests.</li><li>Answer membership and times data-related customer service questions from members. </li><li>Understand USA Swimming’s complex business rules to ensure accurate execution of tasks.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong><u>Qualifications:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 upon hire</li><li>Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, data science, information management, related field or equivalent</li><li>Master’s Degree Preferred</li><li>Minimum 3 years working experience in a professional environment</li><li>Willing to relocate to Colorado Springs, CO</li><li>2+ years of experience with Azure services: Azure Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, Azure SQL DB, Azure Databricks, ML Studio, Azure Data Lake, etc. </li><li>2+ Experience developing and deploying ETL solutions on Azur</li><li>Experience with Azure performance and monitoring tools</li><li>Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)</li><li>Knowledge of OLAP data models, including snowflake and star schemas and cube design</li><li>Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills</li><li>Excellent organizational, multi-tasking, and time-management skills</li><li>Ability to work across departments and in a team setting to help achieve desired goals and outcomes.</li><li>Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong><u>Preferred:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Swimming experience/knowledge of USA Swimming</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Salary &amp; Benefits:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Salary Range for this position is $68,000 - $78,000 / year</li><li>Benefits available include:</li><li>Medical, dental and vision</li><li>Company paid short-term and long-term disability</li><li>Company paid life insurance</li><li>Parental leave</li><li>401(k) w/ match after 1 year of service</li><li>Profit sharing and safe harbor match after 2 years of service</li><li>EAP</li><li>PTO</li><li>12 paid holidays</li></ul>
